tellMeMore.title: Tell me more: Paste Methods Explained
tellMeMore.headline: Understanding Paste Methods
tellMeMore.intro: Different applications handle text input differently. Choose the method that works best for your workflow:

ctrlV.title: Clipboard (Ctrl+V):
ctrlV.description: Uses 'tauri-plugin-clipboard-manager' to write plain text (CF_UNICODETEXT on Windows, text/plain on Linux/macOS) to the OS clipboard, then uses 'Enigo' to simulate the paste shortcut. Handles large text instantly. Note: Clipboard backup/restore only supports text—if you had an image or rich content copied, it will be replaced with the transcription text.

direct.title: Direct:
direct.description: Simulates typing each character individually using the Rust 'Enigo' library. This happens at the OS input level. Slower but more compatible with games, terminals, and legacy apps that block clipboard paste. Newlines work reliably as explicit Enter keypresses.

none.title: None:
none.description: Skips the paste step entirely. Useful if you only want to save the transcription to history or manually copy it later. The text is processed and stored, but no input simulation occurs.

crlfNote.title: Windows Line Endings:
crlfNote.description: LLM responses and some APIs use Unix-style line breaks (LF). Windows applications often expect Windows-style line breaks (CRLF). When enabled, this option converts LF to CRLF before pasting, preventing newlines from being ignored or collapsed.

tellMeMore.tip: Most users should use Clipboard (Ctrl+V). Try Direct if you experience issues with games or terminals.

clipboardHandling.title: Clipboard Handling
clipboardHandling.description: Choose what happens to your clipboard after pasting. 'Restore' attempts to recover the previous text (note: images and files cannot be restored). 'Keep' leaves the transcription in your clipboard for easy re-pasting.
clipboardHandling.descriptionAdvanced: ⚠️ Experimental: Uses Windows clipboard APIs (OpenClipboard, EnumClipboardFormats, GetClipboardData) to backup ALL clipboard formats before pasting, then restores them afterwards. This preserves images, HTML, files, and other rich content. May not work with 'delayed rendering' content. If you experience issues, switch back to 'Restore previous text'.

tellMeMore.title: Tell me more: Connecting the Brain
tellMeMore.headline: Connect the Intelligence.
tellMeMore.intro: Your computer handles the hearing (Speech-to-Text), but it needs a "Brain" to understand and act on complex instructions like "Rewrite this email" or "Translate to Spanish". This Brain is provided by LLM (Large Language Model) API services.

apiKey.title: API Key:
apiKey.description: This is your password to access powerful AI models. You get it from your chosen provider's website after registration.
apiKey.securityNote: Security: Your key is stored locally on this machine and is never sent to our servers.

provider.title: Provider:
provider.description: Choose who provides the intelligence. There are many LLM API providers: OpenAI (GPT-4), Anthropic (Claude), Groq (fast and free tier), Google (Gemini), and aggregators like OpenRouter. You can also use custom/local endpoints.

model.title: Model:
model.description: Each provider offers different models with varying capabilities, speed, and cost. Generally, larger models are smarter but slower and more expensive.

prompts.title: Post-Processing Prompts:
prompts.description: Create custom instructions that run automatically after each transcription. For example: fix grammar, add punctuation, translate, or format as bullet points.

tellMeMore.tip: Easiest way to start: Register a free account on OpenRouter (openrouter.ai). It gives you access to many models from different providers in one place with pay-as-you-go pricing and some free models to try.

privacyWarning.title: Privacy Notice
privacyWarning.description: When you use LLM features (AI Replace, Post-Processing), your text is sent over the Internet to the provider's servers. This includes your transcriptions and any selected text. The provider processes your data according to their privacy policy. Only use providers you trust with your information.

help.title: What is Browser Connector?
help.description: Browser Connector sends your voice transcriptions directly to AI chat interfaces (like ChatGPT, Claude) through the <link>AivoRelay Connector</link> Chrome extension.
help.feature1: Speak and send messages directly to ChatGPT or other AI chats
help.feature2: Use "Send Transcription + Selection" to include selected text as context
help.feature3: Optional LLM processing before sending (e.g., translate, reformat)
help.feature4: Security Recommendation: You should change the connection password. On a fresh install, the extension uses a default password that could allow other programs to intercept your communication. Changing it here will automatically update the extension if it is connected. For maximum security, we recommend doing this while offline to prevent any local interference during the handshake.

extendedThinking.description: Enable reasoning tokens for compatible models (e.g., Claude Sonnet on OpenRouter). The model will "think" before responding, which may improve complex tasks but uses more tokens.

budget.title: Reasoning Budget
budget.description: Maximum tokens the model can use for internal reasoning. Minimum 1024. Higher values allow more complex thinking.

accessibility.permissionsDescription: AivoRelay needs accessibility permissions to type transcribed text.

appLanguage.title: Application Language
appLanguage.description: Change the language of the AivoRelay interface

transcribeFile.title: Transcribe Audio File
transcribeFile.description: Upload an audio file and transcribe it to text. Supports WAV, MP3, M4A, OGG, FLAC, and WebM formats.

dropZone.title: Drop audio file here or click to browse
dropZone.subtitle: Select an audio file to transcribe
dropZone.formats: WAV, MP3, M4A, OGG, FLAC, WebM

outputFormat.label: Output Format
outputFormat.hint: Accurate timestamps (SRT/VTT) require a local model. Remote STT returns text-only output in this version.

customWords.label: Apply Custom Words
customWords.hint: Applies your Custom Words list to this file transcription only.

modelOverride.label: Override Model
modelOverride.hint: Select a specific local model for this transcription. Local models support accurate timestamping for SRT/VTT.

transcribeFile.usePicker: Drag & drop is not supported. Please click to select a file.
transcribeFile.recordingInProgress: Recording in progress. Please wait for it to finish.
